alerts.headline: frost advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas.

Patchy frost is expected overnight into early Tuesday morning.

###

Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Cover up plants, especially those in frost-prone areas. Take preventative measures to protect frost-sensitive plants and trees.

affected_areas.area_description: Deep River - Whitney - Eastern Algonquin Park
Western Algonquin Park - Lake of Two Rivers
Oxtongue Lake - Fort Irwin - Northern Haliburton County
Plevna - Sharbot Lake - Western Lanark County

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Heavy rain tonight.

What:
Total rainfall amounts of 20 to 40 mm with locally up to 50 mm possible.

When:
Ending overnight.

Additional information:
Showers and thunderstorms, which may be heavy at times, will continue to affect the regions south of the highway 11 corridor tonight. Rainfall amounts will vary for the areas south of highway 11 with most expected to see 20 to 40 millimetres. Areas that receive multiple thunderstorms or prolonged downpours may see rainfall amounts of up to 50 mm.

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

affected_areas.area_description: Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake
